DOC.brief_summary: Soccer is a sport that attracts many participants and leads to a substantial number of injuries, especially of the ankle. Enhancement of functional joint stability by kinesio taping proprioceptive training may be important both in prevention and rehabilitation of ankle injuries. The main aim of this study was to determine the effect of kinesio taping and proprioceptive exercises on parameters related to ankle stability, such as the injury incidence, pain, static or dynamic stability and flexibility, in amateur soccer players training 3 times a week.
DOC.brief_title: Study of the Effect of Kinesio Taping and Proprioceptive Exercise on the Stability of Ankle in Amateur Soccer Players
DOC.criteria: To be older than 18 years old. To be soccer player for more than 5 years. Serious illness. Recent ankle injury Vestibulocerebellar disorder Allergy to Kinesio taping Inability to complete all interventional sessions for any reason
